TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit GetUserAvailabilityRequestType extends ExchangeWebServices.BaseRequestType

Docs.summary: The class represents an operation to get the availability information for a user.

remarks.para: The order in which mailboxes are added to the request represents the order in which mailbox information is received in the response.

example.para: The following code example shows you a GetUserAvailability query that includes the following elements:

item.description: A time window for free/busy data that includes today and tomorrow.

A request for detailed and merged free/busy information about the calendar events for each mailbox. This example shows a request for detailed information. However, the actual information that is returned can vary based on the caller's rights to view the calendar information for other mailboxes.
A defined interval for which the merged free/busy data is to be returned; in this case, 30 minutes. This is ignored if merged free/busy data is not requested.
A threshold definition that states that any suggested meeting time where 75% of the attendees are free is considered a Good meeting time.
A window of suggested meeting times that includes today and tomorrow.
A defined maximum number of nonworking hours as suggested meeting times per day; in this case, two.
A maximum number of suggested meeting times per day; in this case, 10.
A time span for suggested meeting times of 30 minutes.
A minimum meeting quality time of Good.
Four mailboxes to query for both free/busy information and suggested meeting times.
A client application that has a locale in the Pacific Standard Time (PST) time zone and that observes daylight saving time.

example.para: The code example returns the free/busy information for each mailbox to the point that the caller has permission to view that data. It also returns a set of suggested meeting times that are organized by day and indicates the availability of the identified mailbox accounts.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: The constructor initializes an instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property ExchangeWebServices::FreeBusyViewOptionsType ^ FreeBusyViewOptions { ExchangeWebServices::FreeBusyViewOptionsType ^ get(); void set(ExchangeWebServices::FreeBusyViewOptionsType ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the free/busy view options for an availability query. This property is optional unless the property is not set. This is a read/write property.

remarks.para: This property is required if the property is not set.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::MailboxData ^> ^ MailboxDataArray { cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::MailboxData ^> ^ get(); void set(cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::MailboxData ^> ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the list of mailboxes to search for an availability query.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property ExchangeWebServices::SuggestionsViewOptionsType ^ SuggestionsViewOptions { ExchangeWebServices::SuggestionsViewOptionsType ^ get(); void set(ExchangeWebServices::SuggestionsViewOptionsType ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the options for meeting suggestion information for an availability query. This property is optional unless the property is not set. This is a read/write property.

remarks.para: This property is required if the property is not set.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property ExchangeWebServices::SerializableTimeZone ^ TimeZone { ExchangeWebServices::SerializableTimeZone ^ get(); void set(ExchangeWebServices::SerializableTimeZone ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the client's time zone information. This includes the transition between standard time and daylight saving time.
